website_summaries.verdict: Classic running shoe design with comfy lightweight cushioning.
pros: A clean design, plenty of cushioning, and an interior construction that promotes blister-free running
Shoe works well for training runs or casual wear
It also feels flexible and ready to go right out of the box
Fit is supportive, and BioMoGO DNA outsole provides responsive cushioning
cons: Runners complain that the fit is a bit narrower than in previous models and the shoe is slightly heavier than the previous iteration

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoe for cushion and comfort!
customer_reviews.text: Great running shoe right out of the box! Highly recommended it......love this shoe. I run 40-50 miles a week.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe, zero break in period
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned a pair of Brooks Launch before, but I can’t recall which ones. I needed a pair of shoes for work and I remembered not having shin or knee pain after wearing them for hours. I’m a nurse and my job requires me to stand on my feet for most of the day. The toe box is roomy without being too wide, moderate arch support and has a nice cushion on my heels. The color is true to the pictures. I normally wear a size 7 , but in tennis shoes I always order a half size up. I’m happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: BellesandBeau

customer_reviews.title: Great arch support —
customer_reviews.text: I have worn Mizuno Wave Riders for about 20 years but found the new version very stiff so I decided to try the Brooks Launch 6. These shoes are very light weight with great arch support which is the most important issue to me. I find them very similar to the Mizuno’s.
customer_reviews.author: NancyC

customer_reviews.title: Solid purchase - if you have been running in Brooks for a while, you know what you will be getting
customer_reviews.text: I have been running in Brooks shoes off/on for about a decade. I love the Launch, and feel they are solid all-purpose running shoes (for 5Ks, all the way up to training for a marathon). I always order 2 sizes bigger than normal shoe size (I'm a 7, order 9). 4 stars because I think the cushioning could be a touch better - but great price for a workhorse running shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Martin

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Love the fact that the toe area is wide. I wore the Launch 5 for my last two pairs. The 6 is even better! Very comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: L. Mesh

customer_reviews.title: Love the brooks running shoes
customer_reviews.text: Love love. I wasn’t able to get this locally when I wanted too. Super fast shipping and excellent fit.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey Rockhold

customer_reviews.title: Always take 1/2 size up from your regular size on Brooks
customer_reviews.text: Born for Brooks (I have 22 pairs) and I love them equally. But do not be fooled that these run any different that all womens Brooks - ALWAYS order 1/2 size up from your regular size. ps...these kind of sparkle, not crazy gawdy bling - just a soft hint. Love 'em - and I love that Brooks is finally making 'true blue' shoes for women moving on from the 'Miami Vice turquoise' they only offered for so long.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe overall
customer_reviews.text: The shoes look nice and seem well-made. I bought them because a shoe-finder quiz indicated they’d be a good choice. I should have just bought the style I know feels good while running AND walking. I haven’t run in them except for short distances and they felt fine. Walking all day is a different story. I need a bit more heel elevation that I’ve found in the Ghost style.
customer_reviews.author: FLBriz

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get this pair of shoes. I have never owned a pair of brooks before, but it seems everyone wears them. They look great, very cute, and fit just as expected! However, they KILLED my ankles when I went on a run. I usually run about 20+ miles a week and have done a couple of half marathon runs. I am not new to running and did not change my route. After a week of running in these (to try to break them in) I had HORRIBLE shin splits. I will only be wearing these on walks or to the gym- NOT for running- as they are still cute.
customer_reviews.author: BeckyC.

customer_reviews.title: really nice sneakers, maybe a bit short
customer_reviews.text: I love these new Brooks sneakers. I have worn Saucony for several years, but have been unimpressed with their quality lately. I also developed a problem with metatarsalgia and was hoping these more supportive sneakers would help. Alas, my condition requires an orthotic, and because these shoes are a tiny bit tighter than I"m used to, the orthotic only seems to fit ok if I'm wearing very thin socks. However, it does fit, and it probably stays in place better because it is a little tighter. I do like the level of cushioning and overall support, I find them comfortable for walking and working out on the elliptical and some light weights. They are nice and stable, too.
customer_reviews.author: killerbugz

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and Supportive
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are FANTASTIC! Once again, Brooks doesn’t disappoint. I purchased these because my old Brooks were worn and I was facing a major knee replacement. I knew I would need supportive shoes for rehabilitation. I’m also a teacher and spend all day on my feet. They have been wonderful AND look super cute. The color combo and design is perfect. I have a high arch and this suffer from plantar fasciitis, but with these shoes I have 0 pain.
customer_reviews.author: Jody Franks

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: I really like how light these are in comparison to my trail shoes I got. I needed wide shoes and these fit perfectly!! They feel like roomy socks Haha super airy so my feet don’t get hot. I love these for jogging and running up stairs/bleachers! These do not come up as high on the ankle as my trail/walking sneakers so I can really work out in these in different ways and not feel held back at all. I get a real spring from the back inside part so it really keeps me going. Plus, they look awesome!!!
customer_reviews.author: AbbyNormal

customer_reviews.title: Love this shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a good pair of walking shoes and the Launch 5 were perfect. I buy a half size larger and with a good pair of padded socks, the fit is perfect for me. I especially appreciate the toe space because there is a good balance of enough wiggle room but not too much so that it affects your natural step. I like this shoe so much that I already purchased a spare! Unless this shoe is dramatically reengineered, I will continue to purchase it.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Friedman

customer_reviews.title: They make your feet hurt
customer_reviews.text: I wore two ti m.j e my feet hurt so bad I couldn't walk .
customer_reviews.author: LIsa ann

customer_reviews.title: Comfy but colors not great
customer_reviews.text: These fit my hard-to-fit feet straight out of the box. Very supportive. I wear a 7, and my toes are a bit wide and my heels a bit narrow. I am not crazy about the color combination. I have the grey and mint green ones. There is glitter in the grey part. I think that makes the color combo even less appealing. I didn't return them because in the midst of the pandemic that is difficult, and I just needed a supportive shoe that would arrive this month. It's a great brand.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Amazing shoe I want another pair!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only had these for one day ran one time in them and they are awesome!! They’re so comfortable and you can literally feel the shoe mold each step! You can really feel the difference When you go from an unsupportive shoe to great support only thing I didn’t like was the mint and grey shoes I got also has little shimmers throughout the shoe as well which you can’t tell from the picture and I also switched to black laces they look way better than the mint lol
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the Ghost shoe
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear the Ghost shoes in the wide width, but I wanted to try another neutral shoe. I read that this one ran wide and was also a neutral shoe, so I thought I’d give it a try. In all, it’s a great shoe for everyday wear, but I don’t love it for running. My toes start to feel numb early in the run, and I was feeling a little bit of strain on my feet from the shoes. In all, I think the Ghost will forever be the best Brooks shoe for neutral support.
customer_reviews.author: MSox

customer_reviews.title: So much better than Asics!
customer_reviews.text: Over many years of running/training I have tried all brands of shoe. Lately Asics was what was recommended by everyone. Well everyone was wrong. Get yourself a good pair of Brooks! Best shoe I have had in YEARS! Stable, well cushioned and the insole is perfect for those of us who have issues with pronation while running. Get a good pair of Brooks. You won't regret it....And, my last pair of Asics fell completely apart in less than a month.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Not my favorite
customer_reviews.text: I have the launch 4 and I love. Got the same size but these just don’t feel as good. They are a little more loose, they also don’t have the same level of support and my feet hurt so much work working out:m. They also have a weird squeaky noise when I walk and run, even my husband can hear and asked about it. Thought it would go away over time and hasn’t. Super disappointed in these compared to the launch 4
customer_reviews.author: Go PSU

customer_reviews.title: Great support
customer_reviews.text: It is difficult to select shoes online without trying them on. I know many runners that wear this brand. I liked that nurses mentioned they wore them all day. I was getting pain in my arch from poor shoe support, so I tried them. I ordered the black/Atlantic/gold. I am very happy with the support. No more arch pain. The color combo works well too. I am very satisfied with the brand and price.
customer_reviews.author: Working Mom

customer_reviews.title: NO shin splits
customer_reviews.text: These shoes made it possible for me to walk on the treadmill again!
customer_reviews.author: lady by the lake

customer_reviews.title: Not meant for training in!
customer_reviews.text: I thought they were great till I ran in them.... they're racing shoes for race day... I thought they were trainers, no support for my planter fasciitis or legs! Not for long runs, I hate them, spent way too much money for my sore feet 😭, I waa waiting for my foot neuroma to get better, that's why I waited to run in them... I was recommended to get Brooks but not all running shoes are the same...
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Morrill

customer_reviews.title: Was expecting better from this brand
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to receive my first pair of Brooks sneakers and I'm a little disappointed. I guess they're supposed to be light and airy, and they are, but I don't feel any support. They're good for short walks or running errands. They would probably be good for the gym (haven't worn them there yet as mine is still closed!). For me, they're not good for long walks or jogs. Also, I have to wear high socks with them because they rub painfully against the backs of my heels and give me blisters otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have had Brooks before, but this was my first pair of the Launch model. Really like these. Recently started running and these are awesome. Really lightweight but still good structure for your foot!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy jogger
customer_reviews.text: I really like these shoes. I have worn them twice now for jogging and have not had any problems. They are well made and good for jogging. I did a lot of research before buying running shoes and Brooks kept popping up as a top running shoe. So far I am very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cute but unsupportive
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are super super cute - I get a lot of compliments! However, they’re not great support for me. I run 1–2 miles per day and do HIIT workouts and my arts is hurting as I run and Pj joe does fall asleep. Also, they fit the width and when I’m standing, but the toe is a smidge longer than a true size 8. Unfortunately, I have to get new shoes after wearing these for a week because of the lack of support.
customer_reviews.author: vanessa t

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: These are super light weight and pretty comfortable. Ran slightly larger than other brookd. And if you have a slight arch, they are great.. I don't suggest for wider feet or super high arches without orthitic. I heavily debated between these and the ghost 12, and decided on the ghost since it is better for my crazy high arches and platar fasciitis. Still. If I had extra cash, I would've kept these also.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love these!
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes! I bought them in the light grey with purple emblem. They are so pretty and so comfortable. I wear a size 8.5 but I bought these in a 9 and they are perfect. I have high arches and have taken them to play golf 4 times and had no problems. I have also tested them out on a few trail walks and they were awesome. Over all I would buy these again. I hope they last. Worth the money so far.
customer_reviews.author: Monique

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been wearing Nike Free shoes to run in for years but I recently broke my toe and now narrower shoes tend to hurt while I run. I heard that Brooks run a bit wide and they’re perfect. They feel great on my runs and don’t hurt my toe at all. I do miss my Nikes but these are great shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite version of the Launch shoe! They’re very light weight and they don’t rub on my ankles the way the Launch 5 did. I also feel like there’s more arch support than the previous model. I’ve run on the treadmill with them and walk around in them, and they felt great. I haven’t had a chance to run outside with, but I don’t think I’ll be let down.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Reichert

customer_reviews.title: Not true to Brooks normal quality.
customer_reviews.text: I have had quite a few pairs of Brooks running shoes and when purchasing them from a store there was never an issue. When I buy them from Amazon, I have purchased two different pairs, they seem cheaply made with absolutely no cushion. I am fully assuming that they are either knock offs or Brooks makes cheaper lesser quality products for a supposed discounted price like outlets do.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart already 😔
customer_reviews.text: I have been waiting to purchase a pair of Brooks because I had heard such great things about them. I am sad to report that after roughly a month the toe part has started coming off. Not what I expected. I really love the shoes, I just wish they wouldn’t have already started falling apart. I walk in them almost daily.
customer_reviews.author: Mann

customer_reviews.title: Brooks has a new loyal customer!
customer_reviews.text: I had the Launch 5s and they were my favorite shoes that I ever had. I had been a New Balance loyal customer for years, but was having more and more trouble with their shoes. My balance is bad, and nothing else I tried was very sturdy. It was time for a replacement though, so I looked for new Brooks shoes. Just as happy with the Launch 6. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Pass on these.
customer_reviews.text: I have two pairs of the prior Launch style and loved them. Needed new ones and ordered the latest. After one day my plantar fasciitis is back and my feet hurt so bad. Change the colors but do you need to change the design every year? These are the worst shoes I have worn in a long time. I’m going to end up paying more to try to get the last yrs style.
customer_reviews.author: Jen S

customer_reviews.title: A smidge tight, great color and thick sole!
customer_reviews.text: I couldn’t tell in the pictures that they had glitter in them but I really like it. Color is great and they are comfortable. They do fit a little tight on top but I figure they’ll get broken in. They have a very thick cushiony, cloud like sole so you get a springy step. I’ve only walked and run a little in them so far.
customer_reviews.author: Krystalle Saucedo

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with lack of support
customer_reviews.text: When I first tried these on, they were comfortable with a nice wide toe box, but after walking in them twice, I needed to add insoles tor support. I expected more support from this brand. This was the first time buying Brooks and don't think I will do so again. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer A. Wittke

customer_reviews.title: Favorite shoes
customer_reviews.text: So comfortable and love the color. The shoe is slightly bigger/wider than other brands, but it was perfect because I just had foot surgery and my foot was a little swollen. I'd say order your typical size and it should fit perfect... its not big enough to need to order up. Just a little extra roomy in the toe area.
customer_reviews.author: BLK

customer_reviews.title: Gotta luv-em Brooks!
customer_reviews.text: I love Brooks! I wear these for working out and for long walks. They have great cushion support. Not too little and not too cushiony. Just right. I can wear these all day and be comfortable. I also wear them around the house when I’m hanging out. Great shoe all around!
customer_reviews.author: Cali girl

customer_reviews.title: These were a flop, but don't judge Brooks on these
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE BROOKS, I OWN 7 PAIRS BUT THESE LACKED THE BROOKS QUALITY AND COMFORT. SIZING WAS A TAD OFF TOO. I RECOMMEND SPENDING THE EXTRA $30-$50 AND GETTING THE PLUSHER CUSHY ONES YOU WON'T GO BACK TO ANY OTHER SNEAKER AFTER YOU TRY THE BROOKS HIGHER END KICKS
customer_reviews.author: MommaB

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes for a busy nurse
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes. They are super cute with just a hint of sparkle. They have good support which is very important for a nurse with severe plantar fasciitis. Came highly recommended by a coworker and I am glad I listened.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love these shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to wear as walking shoes in Europe. I am training for a marathon and wear other Brookes for running but got these for walking. The grey with coral, purple, black accents are literally such good looking shoes. I normally don't like wearing tennis shoes with regular outfits but these are so cute! Like I said launch isn't my goto running shoes (i prefer glycerin or ghost but thats just my prefence) but these were so supportive of my feet my whole trip, so comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Meade

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Running Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my girlfriend because she always complained her feet hurt. She always bought low end shoes. I'm an avid runner so I know the quality of Brooks. She loves them, her feet don't hurt and they look good.
customer_reviews.author: Claytamos

customer_reviews.title: Best one I could find
customer_reviews.text: I fell in love with Brooks 7 years ago. I have high arches and plantar fasciitis. I used to love the Ravenna for the arch support, but 2 years ago they changed how the shoe fits. I tried on every Brooks looking for that perfect fit again. I decided on the Launch 6.
customer_reviews.author: Rach

customer_reviews.title: Happy shoes, happy feet
customer_reviews.text: Love the launch 6. No more ankle issues. Been wearing them for a couple years now. This is my 3rd pair. I have a narrow foot/neutral step and I like toe box room. This pair I’m particularly fond of because my motto is “happiness is a choice”
customer_reviews.author: jejo13

customer_reviews.title: Never go wrong with Brooks
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Brooks I have ordered. Brooks are by far my favorite tennis shoe brand. They are stylish but also have great support. I have to wear them everyday at work and my feet never hurt at the end of the day.
customer_reviews.author: Katlyn

customer_reviews.title: Pinches
customer_reviews.text: I had an issue with my arches with this shoe. I own 5 pairs of Brooks and was told by my podiatrist to use wide for my neuromas. I got these and though it gives more toe room it pinches the top of my feet, I tried different lacing styles but no relief.
customer_reviews.author: PAULINA CHAPA

customer_reviews.title: Worth the investment
customer_reviews.text: These shoes were well worth the investment. They do have a high arch, but I like the extra support. I felt as though they did take some time to "break in", but after that they have been completely comfortable. I will be a repeat customer for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby murphy

customer_reviews.title: Not the quality I'd expect from a Brooks shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have worn Brooks Ghost for years, but haven't run in quite some time and thought I would try a more budget friendly Brooks shoe for my daily walks (retail on the Ghost is $130). I have completely blown through the soles on both shoes in 5 months, and the mesh on both shoes had snags and rips in just a few weeks. I get that you get what you pay for sometimes, but I expected more from a Brooks shoe. As far as fit and support goes, these were great, but I expected a longer wear period from these. I will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Moore

customer_reviews.title: Good neutral shoe
customer_reviews.text: These were recommended by my podiatrist as "the best neutral shoe" and I agree with her. Good fit, good support, and comfortable. Shoe laces could be longer, but that is my only complaint.
customer_reviews.author: A. Frank

customer_reviews.title: Great street running shoes.
customer_reviews.text: I've always had Brooks for running shoes. This would be my 4th pair. It has great support. I am a size 6 Regular and the Launch 6 fits me perfectly. I have no feet soreness after my 5K run 3 times a week. It's great for street running. I can sprint in them and feel my speed increases without much pressure on my legs. I would recommend it for any street runner. I also love the color combo of the black and purple.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My Favs
customer_reviews.text: After years of running in many different brands of shoes, Brooks are by far my favorite and the best fitting for my foot. Also the easiest to break in without rubbing blisters. LOVE them!
customer_reviews.author: JennGee

customer_reviews.title: Ok shoe
customer_reviews.text: These seem cheaper then my past Brooks I've ordered and this is all I wear for walking. not as comfortable and the toe area has an indent in top. I would like to return but I missed the return date as I did not try them on tell about a mo after I bought them . As I bought them before my other ones had worn out all the way.
customer_reviews.author: janey strong

customer_reviews.title: too small
customer_reviews.text: I now wear a 9.5 after 35 years of wearing a size 9. This pair is still too small. Does not have as much cushion as Brooks Addiction (perfect walking shoe). I returned this pair.
customer_reviews.author: suzannes

customer_reviews.title: Extremely stiff
customer_reviews.text: I have many pairs of Brooks. The sole is so stiff in this pair. They just don’t feel the same as my other Brooks. Maybe that’s why they were only $70 compared to the more expensive ones !? Not sure.
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Comfort love
customer_reviews.text: I love the shoes they’re well-made and you can’t beat Brooks!!I’m a stylist and stand on my feet all the time and they keep my legs from hurting!! Well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: tina smith

customer_reviews.title: Love Brooks!!
customer_reviews.text: I love Brooks! They are very comfortable and no need to break in. I wear them daily due to poor ankles and they work great for me. The color of these was fun with a little green sparkle. I normally just like white.
customer_reviews.author: Teri L

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes
customer_reviews.text: Brooks has an excellent reputation with me. I use no other brand to run. I prefer the Glycerin line for me though. I keep these for the style and support for walking. They fit perfectly and look fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: goodnitesaigon

customer_reviews.title: Light and springy !
customer_reviews.text: They are very light weight compared to other running shoes and have lots of spring! Not as much cushion but have support. Comfortable. Great running shoes for 3-5 miles daily.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Morrow

customer_reviews.title: Country of manufacture
customer_reviews.text: I bought my wife the previous version of this shoe, Launch 5. I bought a size 8. It was too small. I exchanged for 8.5 worked fine. My wife bought another pair. Now I bought a Launch 6 8.5. Fits good. There was a change in the country of manufacture. I would not have bought these shoes if I had known. Not sure if information was readily available and just and oversight on my part. Will not return the shoes, but would not have bought them. Wish country of manufacture was as easy so see with mail order as it is in a retail shop.
customer_reviews.author: J.K.

customer_reviews.title: not flexible enough for me
customer_reviews.text: I believe these are good shoes for overpronators although they didn't work for me. I found them to be hard and not flexible enough and I coudn't get used to them. So I gave them to my 13 yo girl and she seems to like them better. She also has flat feet/over pronation.
customer_reviews.author: leah

customer_reviews.title: Not very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This pair of Brooks were my second ever....I was very disappointed as my feet hurt. Also, with the light colors got dirty fast and wore faster than my dark pair.
customer_reviews.author: Janna Michelle Butler

customer_reviews.title: Look & Fit is worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.text: The Brooks Launch collection all have great style, look nice on & are very comfortable. The fit is true to size. The material holds up to daily wear either walking or running. The quality doesn’t deteriorate after 100 miles.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Morris

customer_reviews.title: Cute and light
customer_reviews.text: Much lighter than the ghost. As recommended, I always order a happy side up and alternate between the ghost and these for training :) very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dear Brooks, Please make more!!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love the Launch for road running. These have to be the cutest style/design Brooks ever made. I can't find them any more and it makes me sad....
customer_reviews.author: Betsy Blythe Ogden

customer_reviews.title: Hurt my feel
customer_reviews.text: I have had good luck with Brooks Launch in the past. I have 4 pairs of the Launch 5 and love them, but these hurt my feet. The tongue of the shoe was very narrow and they just seemed cheaply made. I'm going back to the Ghost.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Classic Brooks Comfort
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought the Launch for running a couple months ago and has raved about them since. I decided to give them a try as I previously swore by the Adrenaline line. I have been running 9-10 miles/week in old Reebok crossfit shoes. Needless to say I have been having trouble with knee and hip pain. I have run six miles in these shoes so far. No knee or hip pain! I am so pleased with my purchase and am reminded of the classic comfort Brooks provide.
customer_reviews.author: Haley

customer_reviews.title: Excellent fit:
customer_reviews.text: i love this Brooks shoe so much! I bought it for my home underdesk treadmill, which I walk on 2 hours a day during my 8/9 hr normal workday. I also own another Brooks for the gym but like this pair even better.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany Kirk

customer_reviews.title: Not as comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I like the colors but didnt feel great on my feet. I wear a 9 but Ordered a 9.5. Still fit smaller than expected. I walked in them to give a try but just not good on my feet.
customer_reviews.author: pastorsatx3

customer_reviews.title: Good fit
customer_reviews.text: I really like these. I was unsure of which shoe to buy after liking the purecadence. I went with these and they fit great. No problems on my longer runs. They have more cushion in heel than the others.
customer_reviews.author: Amatek

customer_reviews.title: Hot foot
customer_reviews.text: I bought the same pair of shoes at Academy Sports a year ago. They were perfect for running and I even hiked a part of the AT in them. They were perfect! This pair has been disappointing. They give me horrible “hot foot”. I have no idea why this would occur with the exact same shoe. I guess I will only wear these for casual purposes, definitely NOT for running. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I like that there is a way to make sure I ordered the right size (which is bigger than my normal) for me. They fit perfectly and my feet don't hurt by the end of the day.
customer_reviews.author: RN

customer_reviews.title: Very nice but returned
customer_reviews.text: I liked these shoes but didn’t have much support for being on your feet all day. I returned them and got more supportive brooks the adrenaline. These were very light an mite of a track / running shoe.
customer_reviews.author: knord

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes ever
customer_reviews.text: I swear by these and tell everyone I know to buy a pair. For what it's worth, if you go in person to a Brooks store, you can try on different models of shoes on their treadmills to figure out which style works best for your feet while running. I tried the Levitate 2's in-store and found them to be too springy for my tastes--I preferred the Launch 6's slightly firmer bounce instead. This comes down to personal preference.
customer_reviews.author: Skylar

customer_reviews.title: Good running shoe
customer_reviews.text: Bought these after needing new running shoes. I never buy my running shoes online but these really impressed me. Comfort was amazing went for a 3k the day I got them and felt amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfort for all day wear
customer_reviews.text: Second pair Brooks launch 6, that I bought for work. On my feet majority of the day at work. Very comfortable right out of the box. Color is nice, there are small gold flecks that you can’t really see in the photo. Will continue to buy. Finding a shoe that’s comfortable to wear all day is difficult, but these certainly fit the bill.
customer_reviews.author: D Dawson

customer_reviews.title: Likes and dislikes
customer_reviews.text: It’s very lightweight which is nice, a little more narrow at the toes than I thought but NOT super narrow. Definitely NOT as much cushion on the heel as my asiscs have, but I am satisfied with them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 6 in almost all footwear. However, based on other reviews I sized up to 7 and it fit perfectly for me even with my custom orthotics. Trier them on and it felt like walking on clouds. Highly recommend this brand.
customer_reviews.author: AP

customer_reviews.title: Not as comfortable as older Launch
customer_reviews.text: I used to buy the launch religiously, but this one lacked support and felt stiff. I’m not sure if they changed their design or The materials used but I was disappointed. The return process was easy though and convenient.
customer_reviews.author: S. E. Reichert

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: I am always searching for comfortable shoes. I walk four brisk miles every morning and they have to be right. I love these!
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl

customer_reviews.title: I also had ghost 10
customer_reviews.text: Love brooks. This is my first Launch but I haven’t a complaint. Same size as ghost 10 was. Fit perfect. No blisters. Just put them on and happy life no matter what exercise of life I’m doing. Good shoes are crucial!
customer_reviews.author: JnKBos

customer_reviews.title: Great for Healthcare Workers
customer_reviews.text: I've had these shoes a few months now and they've held up well. I used to get shin splints and my feel would hurt after my shift, but not since wearing these shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Haley

customer_reviews.title: Ready for the next race!
customer_reviews.text: All Brooks sneakers are fantastic and pretty!! These felt great at the first run and pink is my favorite color!
customer_reviews.author: Gina De Shrage

customer_reviews.title: Running shoe
customer_reviews.text: I was unable to use it since it was too small. The size seemed to run a little smaller than my actual size. Super cute look, super comfortable, I’m sure it would have been a great show but I was unable to buy the next size up since it was out of stock.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable tennis shoes!!
customer_reviews.text: I luv these shoes!! They are the perfect fit—-ordered them wide so my feet don’t hurt. Also, they are so light and have the right cushion. I use them for daily aerobics workout. They are so comfortable that I plan to buy another pair in a different color.
customer_reviews.author: ALM

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: I’ll never buy another brand of shoe again. I do a lot of hitt workouts and these are the perfect cross trainer. My feet are never sore after wearing these. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great heel support and firm sole
customer_reviews.text: Great for my heel support. My foot doctor recommended for my Plantar Fasciitis. They fit great and really help my heel. These are the bomb.
customer_reviews.author: Wizard

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and supportive!
customer_reviews.text: These are true to size, I’m usually between an 8.5 and 9, because my feet are a tad wide. I got 8.5 (standard size not wide) and they fit perfectly. They’re very well made, and are very comfortable. I tend to have a lot of foot pain from a previous injury, and these help mitigate the pain, because they have a moderate amount of arch support. Overall, I’m very happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Kody Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Comfy Shoes!!
customer_reviews.text: I had bought a pair of expensive Brooks awhile back and I hated them. They are made very narrow. I found these at DSW and I figured I’d give them a try. They were super comfy, but again they were kind of narrow. So when I found them on here in a wide, I pulled the trigger! They are absolutely perfect! I think the wide is a more normal width than the normal width!
customer_reviews.author: Jenna Mays

customer_reviews.title: If you need plenty of toe box room, this is not the shoe for you.
customer_reviews.text: For a wide shoe. I find the toe box area. Far too. Shallow and narrow I bought these for work. But I will only be wearing them on my days off.
customer_reviews.author: Cherie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome running shoe
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love the launch. It's light weight but still supports your foot and protects your legs. I ran a marathon in them and will definitely continue training in the launch.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Flauter

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes. So light and comfortable for being on your feet for a long time. I bought several pairs of these.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Berardi

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoe
customer_reviews.text: Best running shoes I've ever worn. No break in required! I have problems with heel pain and these helped tremendously!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Jane

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: No arch support. I tried these for a good 3 weeks and my feet hurt so bad every night. Disappointed after hearing Brooks are so comfortable. These are not at all.
customer_reviews.author: Megan M. Schuett

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoe
customer_reviews.text: Love love love! Great running shoes. I am a bit of a Brooks snob. This is definitely one of my favorites.
customer_reviews.author: June Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes ever
customer_reviews.text: Brooks are the best shoes ever and these are a perfect fit. They are very true to size and if you have a wide with foot they are perfect!!
customer_reviews.author: CASSANDRA RICE

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, supportive for midfoot strike
customer_reviews.text: Similar to the Launch 5, which I also loved. I am a midfoot striker and use a natural running form. These have a good amount of midfoot cushion without feeling heavy, too cushy or cumbersome in the least. These are my favorite running shoes. They are lightweight yet provide a good amount of support. I am wearing these while I train for a 10k.
customer_reviews.author: paula biasi

customer_reviews.title: New favorite running shoe brand
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit, ordered my usual size. They are very supportive, for me personally, I especially feel it in my heels & ankles. Great tread. Overall awesome for walking/running.
customer_reviews.author: Mirela K.

customer_reviews.title: Not like the Launch 5. Still a great running shoe, lots of support, but not as sleek.
customer_reviews.text: Don’t expect this shoe to fit like the previous Launch 5. The 6 version is a roomier shoe, feels a bit clunkier all around. Still fits and runs nicely, but prefer the 5 version much more. I would size down what you normally order. I’m usually a 7.5 in the Launch series - I would order the 7 instead.
customer_reviews.author: MAMA OHAYON, DALLAS

customer_reviews.title: Great fit for high arch
customer_reviews.text: I have a high arch nd these feel extremely good. They fit so well I'm going to order a second pair.
customer_reviews.author: Connie Farmer

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: I cannot love these shoes more. As a plantar fasciitis sufferer, I haven't even had to wear my inserts with these! Best purchase! I wear them all day every day.
customer_reviews.author: Melisa B.

product_meta.title: Brooks Women's Launch 6
feature_bullets: THIS SHOE IS FOR: This is a great option for neutral, efficient runners who don’t like a super soft shoe. It has just-right spring and is light enough to be a race shoe for longer distances like the marathon.
ENERGIZED FEEL: Delivers a responsive and springy ride to add extra lift to your stride without compromising support or speed.
SPRINGY CUSHIONING: BioMoGo DNA midsole cushioning and rebounding rubber create a springy feel underfoot.
LIGHTWEIGHT FIT: The one-piece mesh upper and internal bootie are so light and breezy, they feel like they’re not even there.
